summary: The red fox is a large, common carnivore found across the Northern Hemisphere. It has even been introduced to Australia. These foxes are adaptable and can live in various environments. They are often red, but can also be other colors like leucistic (very light) or melanistic (dark). Red foxes live in pairs or small family groups and eat small animals, birds, and sometimes fruit. They are important in the fur trade and have a long history with humans, often being hunted for their fur.
title: Red fox
